abs-cbn.title: Sandiganbayan sends ex-CIDG chief Matillano to jail for perjury
content: MANILA- The Sandiganbayan 2nd Division has sent former Philippine National Police (PNP) Criminal Investigation and Detection Group (CIDG) chief Eduardo Matillano to prison after pleading guilty to perjury and other charges over failed disclosures in his statements of assets, liabilities and net worth (SALN).
The anti-graft court reached the decision following a hearing on Sept. 5, 2017, when Matillano withdrew his not guilty plea and entered a guilty plea instead.

This prompted the court, in a ruling penned by 2nd Division Chairperson Oscar Herrera Jr. with the concurrence of Associate Justices Michael Frederick Musngi and Lorifel Pahimna, to order Matillano's imprisonment.

For each of the 3 cases of perjury, Matillano was sentenced to
“one month and one day and two months of arresto mayor, as minimum, to one year, one day and eight months of prision correcional, as maximum.”
Meanwhile, for each of the 8 cases involving his failure to file SALNs over several years, Matillano was ordered to pay a fine of P1,000.

The Office of the Ombudsman had accused Matillano of perjury for failing to include his assets such as real estate properties, vehicles, and investments in his SALN reports from 2001 to 2003. He was also charged for failing to file SALNs from 1994 to 2000, and in 2004.
 
In September last year, Matillano again made the news when he was mentioned by self-confessed hitman Edgar Matobato as the one who assigned bodyguards to former House Speaker Prospero Nograles who were later allegedly ordered kidnapped and killed by then Davao City Mayor Rodrigo Duterte.
The testimony was part of Matobato's narration of Duterte's alleged involvement in a hit squad, which the President has denied.
Both Matillano and Nograles also denied Matobato's claim.

abs-cbn.title: ALAMIN: 'Green jobs' na magiging in demand sa hinaharap
content: Bukod sa magandang epekto sa kalikasan, milyon-milyong trabaho din sa buong mundo ang inaasahang madadagdag sa susunod na 13 taon dahil sa patuloy na paglawak ng 'green economy'.

Ayon sa United Nations agency na International Labor Organization (ILO), 60 milyong trabaho ang maidadagdag sa buong mundo hanggang 2030 dahil sa paglawak ng 'green economy' at pagdami ng 'green jobs'. 
    
Isang halimbawa nito ang renewable energy sector, ang electric vehicles sa transport sector, at ang eco-waste management sector na nagsusulong ng mas maayos na pamamahala ng basura gaya ng recycling at composting.
Dagdag pa ng ILO, nagsisimula na ito ngayon dahil mayroon nang 5.8 milyon na trabaho sa renewable energy sector sa Asia-Pacific region pa lang.
Karamihan dito ay nasa China, pero humahabol na rin ang Pilipinas.
Nakapagbigay na rin ng 80,000 na trabaho sa mga Pinoy ang pag-unlad ng industriya ng renewable energy sa bansa, ayon sa ILO.
Isa si Gerry Chua sa mga young Pinoy entrepreneur na nagbebenta ng solar panels sa mga residente at establisimyento.
Kahit bago pa lang ang kaniyang business, mayroon na siyang 12 full-time employees, bukod pa sa mga skilled worker na ina-outsource niya.
Sabi ni Chua, dumadami talaga ang job opportunities sa sektor ng renewable energy dahil kailangan ng skilled workers sa pag-install ng equipment at pati sa maintenance nito.

Ayon naman kay Cristina Martinez, senior specialist on environment and decent work ng ILO, maganda ang environment ng Pilipinas para sa 'green jobs' dahil may suporta ng iba’t ibang sektor at nasa kultura na rin ng mga Pinoy ang pangangalaga sa kalikasan.
Dagdag pa ni Martinez, malaking oportunidad din ito para sa mga Pilipino.
Mas dadami ang mangangailangan ng skilled workers sa 'green economy' gaya ng solar PV technical engineer, wind turbine service technician, electrical engineer, at power resources manager.
Malaki umano ang bentahe ng mga manggagawa na maituturing na skilled o may kasanayan sa mga bagong teknolohiya.
-- Ulat ni Apples Jalandoni, ABS-CBN News

abs-cbn.title: SAPUL SA CCTV: Estudyante, nabudol-budol ng nagpakilalang nanay ng kaklase
content: Sapul sa CCTV ang "budol-budol" modus ng isang babae sa Valenzuela City, nitong Lunes, Setyembre 25.
Naglalakad ang 13 anyos na estudyante sa Karuhatan Road sa Valenzuela nang sundan siya ng isang babae.
Ilang minuto pa, makikita sa kuha ng CCTV na nag-uusap sila sa isang tabi at pagkatapos ay sabay na naglakad patungo sa paradahan ng mga motorsiklo.
Dito na umano kinuha at hinalungkat ng babae ang bag ng estudyante at tila may kausap pa sa cellphone.
Bagama’t hindi na nakuha sa CCTV ang ibang pangyayari, ayon sa barangay, kinuha ng babae ang cellphone at wallet ng dalagita.
Pinalabas umano ng babae na nanay siya ng kaklase ng biktima at sinabing nawala ang cellphone ng kanyang anak kaya gusto niyang ininspeksyunin ang bag ng dalagita.
Ikatlong kaso na ito ng budol-budol na idinulog sa barangay, ayon sa mga awtoridad.
Dagdag pa nila, lahat ng biktima ay mga estudyanteng ninakawan ng cellphone.
Ang iba pang taktika ng modus, mag-aabang ang mga mambubudol ng isang mamimiling mayroong hawak ng isang mamahaling cellphone sa loob ng isang department store.
Palalabasin umano ng suspek na mayroong mali sa mga pinamili ng biktima.
Kunwari’y dadalhin sa counter ang mamimili upang i-double check ang mga gamit, saka siya bibiktimahin, paliwanag ni Patrick Perez, Executive Officer III ng Brgy. Karuhatan.
Ayon pa kay Perez, nahihirapan silang hulihin ang babae dahil paiba-iba ang oras ng kaniyang pambibiktima.
Naglabas na rin sila ng anunsiyo sa social media upang maalerto ang mga taga-Valenzuela sa suspek.
Nagpahayag din sila sa publiko na agad makipag-ugnayan sakaling makita ang suspek ng budol-budol.
Babala ng barangay sa mga estudyante, huwag basta-bastang makikipag-usap sa mga taong hindi kilala.
Pinaghahanap pa rin ng barangay ang suspek na madalas umanong mambiktima ng mga estudyante.
-- Ulat ni Kristine Sabillo, ABS-CBN News

abs-cbn.title: ALAMIN: Buwis sa bonus sa ilalim ng panukalang bagong tax rate ng Kamara, Senado
content: Kung buwis lang ng mga swelduhang manggagawa ang pag-uusapan, mas malaki ang antas ng sahod na tax-free sa bersiyon ng bagong tax rate ng Kamara kumpara sa Senado.
Pinapatawan ngayon ng P50,000 na income tax ang may taunang P250,000 na net income.
Wala nang buwis ang mga kumikita ng nasabing halaga sa bersiyon ng Kamara.
Pero sa bersiyon ng Senado, papatawan pa rin ito ng P15,000 na buwis.
Wala na kasing exemption sa bersiyon ng Kamara kahit may anak pa ang manggagawa habang may tig-P25,000 exemption naman kada anak sa bersiyon ng Senado.
Para naman sa medyo malaki na ang suweldo, bababa pa rin ang tax rate kung ikukumpara sa kasalukuyang buwis.
Sa kabila nito, mas pabor umano sa manggagawa ang bersiyon ng Kamara dahil mas maliit ang personal income tax.
Halimbawa na lamang kung may taunang kita na P500,000, mayroon lamang P55,000 buwis sa House version kumpara sa P70,000 na ipapataw sa Senate version.
Sa 13th month pay at iba pang bonus, walang buwis sa bersiyon ng Kamara kung hindi ito lalagpas ng P100,000 habang hanggang P82,000 lamang ang tax-free sa bersiyon ng Senado.
Pabor naman ang tax experts sa bersiyon ng Kamara dahil wala na itong exemptions kaya madaling intindihin ng karaniwang mamamayan.
Pero masyado rin anilang mataas ang 35% na income tax sa House version para sa mga kumikita ng mahigit P5 milyon kada taon.
-- Ulat ni Alvin Elchico, ABS-CBN News

abs-cbn.title: Kahalagahan ng teknolohiya sa panahon ng sakuna, pinagtuunan sa shake drill
content: Itinuloy na nitong Miyerkoles, Setyembre 27, ang ikatlong nationwide earthquake drill, na ipinagpaliban mula sa inisyal nitong petsa noong Setyembre 21.
Alas-2 ng hapon nang nangsimulang tumunog ang alarm sa gymnasium sa Bacoor, Cavite na senyales ng pag-uumpisa ng shake drill sa buong bansa.

Agad itong sinundan ng sinanay na “Duck, Cover and Hold.”
    
Kaniya-kaniya namang toka ang coordinating agencies sa mga dapat gawin sa larangan ng evacuation at search and rescue.
Dahil sa malawak ang lugar na inaasahang tatamaan sakaling maganap ang 7.2 magnitude na lindol, binigyang pansin sa isinagawang shake drill ang kahalagahan ng teknolohiya.
Isang LED monitor ang nakakabit sa gym ng Bacoor na gagawing sentro ng evacuation.
Makikita sa monitor ang lahat ng nangyayari at sitwasyon sa iba pang siyudad sa Cavite gaya ng sa Imus, General Trias, Silang, Bacoor, at Trece Martires.
Sabay sa oras ang nakikitang shake drill kaya inaasahang mas magiging mabilis ang magagawang assessment, pagbibigay-tulong at pagresponde sa mga nangangailangan.
Samantala, bukod sa pagguho ng mga bahay at gusali, inaasahan din ang mga pagtagas ng iba’t ibang klase ng kemikal at sunog.

Ayon kay Usec. Renato Solidum Jr., Officer-in-Charge ng Philippine Institute of Volcanology and Seismology (Phivolcs), kailangang mabigyan ng tamang paghahanda at kaalaman ang lahat ng Pilipino tungkol sa lindol.
Iba’t ibang probinsiya rin ang nakilahok sa naturang shake drill.
Sa Batangas City, na ilang beses nang tinamaan ng lindol nitong nakaraang buwan, nakilahok ang nasa 500 estudyante at mga empleyado.

Pinaigting na rin ang shake drill sa Leyte dahil dinadaanan ito ng fault line, habang sa Iloilo City, nagpraktis ang mga doktor at nars ng Iloilo Mission Hospital sa tamang pag-aasikaso at pagbibigay-lunas sa mga posibleng maaapektuhan ng lindol.
Sa Ilagan City, Isabela, nagsagawa ang pamahalaan ng training sa pagresponde sa mga maaaring ma-trap sa mga gusali, gayundin ang pagsugpo sa mga sisiklab na sunog.
Ayon kay Solidum, mahihirapan pang isagawa ang sinasabing biglaang earthquake drill o “surprise drills.”
Aniya, susubukan muna nila ang maliliit na surprise drills sa mga opisina.
Isa pang nationwide earthquake drill ang nakakasa bago matapos ang taon.
-- Ulat ni Doris Bigornia, ABS-CBN News

abs-cbn.title: 2 killed in Cagayan de Oro drug bust
content: Two drug suspects were killed in a police buy-bust operation in Upper Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City on Wednesday afternoon.
The two were identified as Carmelito Salvidas from Lanao del Norte and Ernesto Bradero from Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental.
Police Chief Inspector Richie Salva, chief of Police Station 4, said they were forced to shoot the suspects when one of them attempted to throw a hand grenade at the operatives.

Two sachets of suspected shabu, P300 buy-bust money, assorted drug paraphernalia, an MK2 fragmentation grenade, and a stolen motorcycle were recovered from the scene in on Block 59, Xavier Heights Subdivision, Upper Balulang.
The stolen motorcycle was identified by the owner, Marjun Saloloy.
Saloloy said his motorcycle was stolen outside his house in Upper Carmen, Cagayan de Oro Tuesday night.
Authorities said the two suspects were also behind several carjacking cases in Cagayan de Oro and nearby towns.
They added that Salvidas was recently released from jail.
Police are gathering information on the suspects' companion who owns the house.

abs-cbn.title: Binatilyo patay matapos magulungan ng truck sa Benguet
content: Pabalik na sana sa opisina ang isang binatilyo nang mahulog siya sa truck na sinasakyan at magulungan sa Taloy Sur, Tuba, Benguet nitong Linggo.
Pahinante si John Mark Haban, 15, ng truck na nagde-deliver ng construction materials.
Nakasakay sa likod ng truck si Haban kasama ang iba pang kaibigan. Day-off niya at ng kanyang mga kasamahan nang mangyari ang insidente.

“Lumalabas po na 'yung namatay ay nakainom, mukhang nakabitaw siya sa pagkahawak dun sa truck, kaya nahulog at nagulungan dun sa ilalim. Nakasakay po siya sa likod ng ELF, medyo kaway nang kaway, pinipigilan,” ani police Insp. Rolando Lagayan, deputy station commander ng Tuba Police.
Agad isinugod sa ospital si Haban, pero hindi na ito umabot ng buhay.
“Parang nagulungan sa tiyan, kasi nung binuhat namin, wala na, patay na talaga, hindi na siya humihinga eh,” ani alias Michael, isa sa mga kaibigan at kasamahan ng biktima.
Kahit pinakabata sa mga trabahador, isa daw sa pinakamasipag si Haban.
“Masipag, pag tinatawag ni boss mag-repair, nagre-repair siya, lahat ng sinasabi, ginagawa niya, hindi naman namin alam na ganun ang mangyayari sa kanya," dagdag ni alias Michael.
Hindi nagsampa ng reklamo ang pamilya ng biktima.

abs-cbn.title: Isa pang idinawit sa pagkasawi ng law student, sumuko; pero may 'excuse'
content:
- Nasa ospital umano ang sumukong lalaki nang panahong sumailalim sa hazing si Horacio Castillo III
- Ipinag-utos na ng DOJ na pakawalan ang naunang sumukong suspek na si John Paul Solano 
- Inihatid na sa huling hantungan ang labi ni Castillo
Aegis Jvris member Jason Robiños surrenders at the MPD in connection with the fatal hazing of Atio Castillo | via @angelmovido pic.twitter.com/RQGzR6neyu
Sumuko sa tanggapan ng Manila Police District (MPD) nitong Miyerkoles, Setyembre 27, ang isa pang iniuugnay sa pagkamatay ng hazing victim na si Horacio "Atio" Castillo III.
Bandang alas-6 ng hapon, sumuko si Jason Robiños, isa sa mga miyembro ng Aegis Jvris Fraternity.
Kabilang si Robiños sa mga nasa lookout order na dating ipinalabas ng Department of Justice (DOJ).
Ayon kay Adenn Sigua, abogado ni Robiños, nais nilang mapatunayang walang kinalaman si Robiños sa pagkamatay ni Castillo.
Depensa ni Robiños, nasa ospital siya nang maganap ang hazing dahil sa gastroenteritis.
Samantala, ipinag-utos ng DOJ na pakawalan mula sa pagkakapiit sa MPD ang pangunahing suspek na si John Paul Solano.
Sa limang pahinang resolusyon, sinabing dapat pakawalan si Solano dahil kusa naman siyang sumuko noon.
Pero hindi pa nakalalaya si Solano dahil ayon sa abogado niyang si Paterno Esmaquel, hindi pa naibibigay sa kanila ang release order na inilabas bandang alas-5 ng hapon.
Pinangalanan ni Solano noong Lunes, Setyembre 25, ang anim na kasamahan sa Aegis Jvris Fraternity at isa pang indibidwal na may kinalaman sa pagkasawi ni Castillo.
Sa Oktubre 4 at 9 nakatakda ang paunang imbestigasyon sa kaso.
Kuha ng CCTV sa frat library
Kumbinsido naman ang pulisya na sa fraternity library ng Aegis Jvris sa Sampaloc, Maynila idinaos ang pag-hazing kay Castillo, batay sa nakuhang mga CCTV footage.
Sa kuha ng CCTV ng Barangay 47 noong Setyembre 16, Sabado, huling nakitang naglalakad si Castillo sa kahabaan ng Dapitan Street bandang ala-1:20 ng hapon.
Kinausap niya ang Uber driver na naghatid ng gamit niya sa tirahan sa Makati.

Sa kuha ng mga CCTV ng Barnagay 471 sa Laong Laan at Navarra Street mula Setyembre 16 hanggang umaga ng Setyembre 17, makikitang labas-pasok ang mga hinihinalang miyembro ng Aegis Jvris sa kanilang library.
Noong Setyembre 17, Linggo, alas-2 ng umaga, isang lalaki at babae ang lumabas sa library. Nagsusuka ang babae na tila nakainom habang inaalalayan ng lalaki.
Pasado alas-7 ng umaga, lumabas naman ang isang estudyanteng may kausap sa cellphone at palakad-lakad na tila balisa.
Bandang alas-8:42 hanggang alas-8:45 ng umaga, sa may Santander at Rosarito Street, nakunan sa CCTV ang convoy ng mga miyembro ng fraternity.
Kabilang dito ang isang itim na SUV, isa pang SUV, pulang pick-up truck, at motorsiklong minamaneho ni Solano.
Sa CCTV ng Chinese General Hospital, alas-8:45 umaga noong Linggo, Setyembre 17, nakunang dumating ang convoy sa ospital.
Bandang alas-9:02 ng umaga nang lumabas sa ospital ang pulang pick-up truck at makalipas ang apat na minuto'y sumunod ang itim na SUV.
Pinaniniwalaang sa pulang pick-up truck isinakay ang katawan ni Castillo.
Inihatid sa huling hantungan
Pasado alas-5 ng hapon nitong Miyerkoles, inilibing na si Castillo sa mawsoleo ng kaniyang lolo sa Manila Memorial Park sa Parañaque.
Maagang dumating ang mga magulang ni Castillo at kaniyang kapatid sa chapel kung saan siya ibinurol.
Dumalo rin ang mga kababata, kaibigan, at kamag-aral ni Castillo para makipaglibing.
Sa una'y humingi ng privacy at panahon ang pamilya na makasama si Castillo sa chapel bago pinapasok ang media.
Nakasuot ng mga damit na may nakasulat na "Justice for Horacio" ang mga kaanak.
LOOK: Lega wearing "#JusticeForHoracio" shirt. She's with Nicolle, younger sister of Atio | via @koriquintos pic.twitter.com/4QItdh8cGz
Ang aso ni Castillo na si Lega, nakasuot din ng "justice" shirt at sumilip din sa amo sa huling pagkakataon.
Nagdala ng malaking banner ang Volunteers Against Crime and Corruption na humihingi ng hustisya para sa pagkamatay ni Castillo.
Mahigit 200 paruparo ang pinakawalan sa libing ni Castillo bilang simbolo ng paghingi ng katarungan.
-- Ulat nina Johnson Manabat, Angel Movido, Kori Quintos, at Oman Bañez, ABS-CBN News

abs-cbn.title: The Day in Photos: 27 September 2017
Mag-uuling, patay sa pamamaril sa Pangasinan
content: PANGASINAN - Patay sa pamamaril ang isang lalaki Miyerkoles ng umaga sa Barangay Sampaloc sa bayan ng Bolinao, Pangasinan.
Kinilala ang biktima na si Ricky Gonzales, alyas Bong, 39 taong gulang at isang mag-uuling.
Nag-iigib umano ito ng tubig nang lapitan at pagbabarilin ng mga lalaking sakay ng motorsiklo.
Nagtamo ng tama sa ulo at kanang braso si Gonzales. Tinamaan din sa paa ang 17 taong gulang na anak nito.
Ilan sa mga anggulong tinitingnan ng otoridad ay ang kaso nitong illegal possession of firearms noong nakaraang buwan.
Sangkot din umano ito sa alitan sa lupa.
Ayon sa asawa ng biktima, alam niyang may mga nagbabanta sa buhay nito.
Patuloy ang imbestigasyon sa insidente.

abs-cbn.title: Bautista impeachment not over yet after House panel dismissal, says Roque
content: MANILA—Kabayan party-list Representative Harry Roque is not giving up on the impeachment complaint against Comelec chairman Andres Bautista that was junked by the House justice committee after finding it insufficient in form.

Roque, who endorsed the impeachment complaint filed by lawyer Ferdinand Topacio‏ and former Negros Oriental representative Jacinto Paras, said the committee decision will still be reviewed by the plenary.
“If one-third of the House members will say the impeachment must continue, then articles of impeachment can still be filed. I certainly have not thrown in the towel,” he told reporters Wednesday.
The lawmaker also claimed his colleagues from the justice committee dismissed the complaint for insufficiency of form over a faulty verification supposedly because they assumed Bautista will resign.

“As we near the deadline for plenary to review the decision of the committee on justice, many of our colleagues will be asking themselves, ‘Seryoso bang magre-resign itong si Chairman Bautista,’ ” he said.
Six Comelec commissioners previously said Bautista “could no longer effectively lead” and that it was time for him to resign. In response, the poll chief said he is turning to prayer.
The impeachment complaint against Bautista stemmed from the allegation by his estranged wife, Patricia, that he was hiding unexplained wealth, allegations the poll chief has repeatedly denied.

abs-cbn.title: PH, China set bilateral meeting for joint development in West PH Sea
content: Philippine and Chinese energy officials have set a bilateral meeting on Thursday to discuss the joint development in the West Philippine Sea, an official said Wednesday.
Energy Secretary Alfonso Cusi said both sides have not yet reached any agreement and that the possibility of lifting the moratorium on exploration in the West Philippine Sea is still being studied.

"We have five pending service contracts and we are still studying the ways we are going to lift the moratorium order. But I do not like to create any speculation. We have not reached any agreement," he said.

Cusi said Service Contract 57, which covers offshore Northwest Palawan or west of Calamian islands, is already with the Office of the President for signature so that exploration work could begin. He said SC 57 is within the Philippine territory.

The service contract has been pending since 2005 but was delayed due to administrative issues. According to the contract, China National Offshore Oil Company (CNOOC) farmed-in into SC 57 in 2006 acquiring 51 percent participating interest and operatorship. The deed of assignment to formalize its entry has yet to be signed by the President.
"We have SC 57 that is already with the Office of the President so that we can pursue its exploration work," Cusi said.
"We have already finished the documentation, the contract and it's presented already to the Office of the President for signing."

Energy Undersecretary Donato Marcos meanwhile stressed there is no sovereignty issue involved in SC 57 as it is not within the disputed area of the West Philippine Sea.
 
"It's not a joint exploration actually because it's a current service contracted granted by the Department of Energy to Pnoc Exploration Corporation (PNOC EC), then it's a 100 hundred percent owned by PNOC EC. Ngayon mag fafarm-in si CNOOC. So sovereignty here is not an issue. Besides, it's not within the disputed area of the West Philippine Sea," Marcos said.

On Thursday, energy ministers of the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN) will meet with their counterparts from China, South Korea, Japan, as well as New Zealand, Australia, India, US and Russia, all of whom are expected to present recommendations on how to achieve the objectives of the ASEAN Plan of Action for Energy Cooperation.

abs-cbn.title: Palace: No appointment yet for Martin Diño
content: MANILA - Malacañang on Wednesday clarified that sacked Subic Bay Metropolitan Authority (SBMA) Chairman Martin Diño has not been given a new appointment after the latter said he has accepted a post as undersecretary at the Department of the Interior and Local Government (DILG).

“As of this date, the President has not appointed Mr. Martin Diño to any position in the Department of Interior and Local Government (DILG) or in any instrumentality of government,” Presidential Spokesperson Ernesto Abella said in a statement.
Abella issued this clarification after Diño on Wednesday said he has been tapped to serve as DILG Undersecretary for Barangay Affairs.

Malacañang had announced Tuesday that President Rodrigo Duterte removed Diño from his previous post following complaints about "the way he was running the SBMA," said Chief Presidential Legal Counsel Salvador Panelo.
"Marami rin akong nakausap na investors dun. Ayaw nila si Diño," he said, adding he advised them to outline their concerns in a letter to the President.
Duterte had the matter investigated and decided "effectively" to sack Diño by assigning Wilma Eisma as concurrent SBMA chairman and administrator, Panelo said. She took oath on Tuesday.

Eisma’s appointment ends the power struggle between her and Diño, with whom she had been at odds over certain decisions in the agency. The two officials had issued contradicting orders that affected SBMA operations.

Diño's removal from his post also came in the wake of the President’s signing of Executive Order No. 42, which repealed EO No. 340 issued by former President and now Pampanga Rep. Gloria Macapagal Arroyo in 2004.
The old EO had separated the “powers, functions and duties of the Chairman of the SBMA Board and the Administrator as Chief Executive Officer of the SBMA.”

Diño, a former chairperson of the Volunteers Against Crime and Corruption (VACC), served as the presidential candidate of Duterte's party, Partido Demokratiko Pilipino–Lakas ng Bayan, in the May 2016 elections until then Davao City Mayor Duterte decided to run for the position, replacing him at the last minute.

His daughter Liza Diño-Seguerra was appointed Film Development Council of the Philippines (FDCP) Chairperson in August while her spouse Aiza Seguerra was appointed Chairperson of the National Youth Commission.

abs-cbn.title: Mag-lolo, patay nang madaganan ng trak na nahulog sa tulay
content: Umakyat na sa dalawa ang nasawi matapos madaganan ng trak na nahulog sa tulay sa Pandacan, Maynila.
Dead on the spot ang 70 anyos na si Danilo Baltazar habang napitpit sa ilalim ng trak ang kaniyang apong si John Dave, 8 anyos.
Ilang oras naipit ang bata sa truck bago tuluyang naiangat ang trak sa tulong ng crane.
Pero patay na ang bata nang makuha sa trak.
Naipit din sa trak ang kapitbahay nilang si Clarita Sarias na kasalukuyang ginagamot sa ospital.
Sugatan din sa insidente ang drayber ng trak na si Reinaldo Acosta at pahinanteng si Herman Pider.
Panay ang hingi ng pasensiya ng driver.
Giit niya, aksidente ang nangyari dahil nawalan umano ng preno ang trak.
Inakala niyang mapipigilan ito ng railing ng tulay pero bumigay ang harang at nagtuloy-tuloy na ang trak sa bahay ng informal settlers na nasa ilalim ng tulay.
Iniimbestigahan ngayon ng pulisya ang pananagutan ng driver sa insidente.
-- Ulat ni Pia Gutierrez, ABS-CBN News

abs-cbn.title: Another suspect in 'Atio' hazing surrenders
content: MANILA (UPDATED) - Another suspect in the fatal hazing of University of Santo Tomas law freshman Horacio Castillo III surrendered to the Manila Police District (MPD) Wednesday afternoon.
He submitted himself to authorities just as Castillo was laid to rest and while one of the primary suspects, John Paul Solano, was released.

Jason Robiños is one of the members of the Aegis Jvris fraternity tagged in Castillo's death more than a week ago. The 22-year-old suffered a heart attack after sustaining massive injuries in initiation rites.
Robiños said he is an inactive member of the fraternity and added that he was not involved in Castillo's hazing.
He was among fraternity members listed in an immigration lookout bulletin order released by the Department of Justice to monitor the suspects' movements through the country's ports.
Robiños attended the Senate inquiry on Castillo's death Monday.
His lawyer, Adenn Sigua, said Robiños waited to surrender until a CCTV footage that shows he was in his boarding house during the incident, was recovered.
Sigua added that his client was hospitalized at the Fe del Mundo Hospital on September 14 and was released at around 2 p.m. on September 16, the day of Castillo's initiation rites.
Aside from providing the CCTV footage as evidence, Robiños also filed a sworn statement and submitted medical certificates.
"He was diagnosed with diabetes and advised na hindi na dapat mag attend ng kahit anong activity. We strongly deny na may knowledge siya with any activity sa hazing," Sigua said.

Earlier, another member of the fraternity whose identity was withheld, submitted himself and gave his statement to the National Bureau of Investigation after initially communicating with Justice Secretary Vitaliano Aguirre II.
--Report from Angel Movido, ABS-CBN News

abs-cbn.title: Trump, Kim wage war of words
Sereno got P30-million Piatco case fee in tranches, only portion declared in 2010 SALN: lawyers
content: MANILA - Chief Justice Maria Lourdes Sereno received in tranches her P30-million fee for serving as government counsel in arbitration proceedings against the Philippine International Air Terminals Co. Inc. (Piatco), builder of the Ninoy Aquino International Airport (NAIA) Terminal 3, her legal team said Wednesday.

Sereno's lawyer Josa Deinla said this was among reasons why the full amount does not appear in Sereno's 2010 statement of assets, liabilities, and net worth (SALN), which was used as basis for an impeachment complaint that lawyer Larry Gadon filed against the chief magistrate.

She added that over the course of 5 years, Sereno also incurred expenses, such as hospitalization and funeral costs for her parents, her purchase of properties, investments, and other regular household and family expenses.

"It (P30 million) would not remain intact because ginastos na niya. Maraming expenses ang mga tao. Marami siyang pinaggagastusan, hindi lang 1 year, kundi in 5 years. And she received the amount not in lump sum ha, but periodically," Deinla told ANC's Headstart on Wednesday.

Lawyer Winnie Salumbides, meanwhile, said he is puzzled by Gadon's accusation that Sereno did not pay the correct taxes when the Piatco payment already had withholding taxes. He added that the Chief Justice had a tax credit because she paid more than what was due.

The Sereno camp emphasized that, in accordance with the law, the Chief Justice declared in her SALN her assets and liabilities at the time she was declaring it, or what was left of the money she had been paid.

The allegation that she had made misdeclarations in her SALN is considered the strongest in the Gadon complaint as her predecessor, the late Chief Justice Renato Corona, was impeached and put on trial over the same charges.

Deinla and Salumbides reiterated that Gadon's impeachment complaint was based on "bare-faced" lies from unverified sources, as they answered each accusation against the Chief Justice during the ANC interview.

They said Sereno is a target for impeachment because of her position, conviction, independence and conscience, as evident in rulings of the Supreme Court that were unfavorable to former President Benigno "Ninoy" Aquino III, who had appointed her in 2012.

Gadon's complaint alleges that Sereno had committed culpable violation of the Constitution, betrayal of public trust, corruption, and other high crimes for allegedly lying in her SALN, falsification of High Court documents, delayed court action, alleged use of judiciary funds for a P5-million vehicle, and luxury travels, among others.

abs-cbn.title: Batang lalaki, minolestiya umano ng guro
content: Inireklamo ng pangmomolestiya ang isang lalaking guro sa Cauayan City, Isabela.
Kuwento ng ina ng biktima, ginawan umano ng kahalayan ng guro ang 12 anyos na lalaking estudyante matapos ang kanilang huling subject sa hapon.
Naatasan daw na "cleaner" o tagalinis ng silid-aralan ang estudyante kaya nanatili siya sa classroom pagkatapos ng klase.
Kuwento ng menor de edad sa ina, isinara ng guro ang pintuan ng silid-aralan at ibinaba ang mga kurtina ng kuwarto.
Nilapitan daw ng guro ang estudyante, binuksan ang zipper ng pang-ibabang uniform, at isinubo umano ang ari ng estudyante.
Hulyo 20 nangyari umano ang insidente pero Setyembre 7 na nang i-report ito ng biktima sa guidance counselor. Nalaman ito ng ina ng menor de edad makalipas ang ilang araw.
Ayon sa ina, natakot ang kaniyang anak at nagkaroon lamang ng lakas ng loob nang malamang ililipat sa ibang paaralan ang guro.
Una nang naghinala ang ina na may nangyari sa anak bago pa isiniwalat ng biktima ang insidente.
Nag-iba raw kasi ang ugali ng anak at nawalan din ng ganang pumasok sa eskuwelahan.
Sinubakan ng ABS-CBN News na makapanayam ang punong-guro ng paaralan at lokal na sangay ng Department of Education pero hindi sila tumutugon.
Ayon sa pulisya, hindi ito ang unang insidenteng may hinalay ang nasabing guro.
Inihain na sa piskalya ang reklamong sexual abuse laban sa guro.

Pansamantalang huminto ang bata sa pag-aaral upang sumailalim sa counseling.
 
Payo ng pulisya na magkaroon ng mabuting komunikasyon sa pagitan ng mga magulang at anak para malaman agad kung mayroong pinagdaraanang problema ang bata.

Wala ang gurong inirereklamo sa kaniyang bahay at nag-leave din umano sa paaralang pinaglipatan.
 
-- Ulat ni Danielle Rebollos, ABS-CBN News

abs-cbn.title: Looking a lot like X'mas
Truck falls from bridge in Manila
A life cut short: hazing victim 'Atio' laid to rest
content: MANILA - Hazing victim Horacio "Atio" Castillo III was laid to rest at the Manila Memorial Park in Parañaque City Wednesday afternoon as his family cried for justice.
WATCH: Lega wearing "Justice for Horacio" shirt looked at Atio before the interment this afternoon |via @koriquintos pic.twitter.com/vwe2I4FemP

Castillo's family, friends, and his golden retriever Lega attended the funeral mass and burial clad in white shirts that decried the untimely death of the University of Santo Tomas (UST) law freshman, a 22-year-old who was described as a "humble kid with big dreams."
Castillo's dream of becoming a lawyer ended more than a week ago in initiation rites at the Aegis Jvris fraternity, where he had hoped to find a brotherhood.
"Atio," as he was fondly called by family and close friends, had told his parents that he would be attending the fraternity's welcoming rites on Sept. 16. He never made it back home.

Severely battered, Castillo had a heart attack after sustaining "massive injuries" in the hands of fraternity members. He was rushed to the hospital Sunday morning but was already lifeless. His parents learned of his passing before dawn the next day.

"Atio was brutally murdered. Our son is a perfect son! We will miss you terribly. But we will be OK. We will fight for justice," Atio's father, Horacio Jr., said in a speech delivered after the funeral mass.
About 250 butterflies and balloons were released as Castillo was laid to rest.

In saying their final goodbye, Castillo's family and friends kept on reliving his life through stories about how he had survived a fire when he was just 10-years old, and how he eventually graduated with a degree in Political Science in UST.
Bea Garcia, one of his childhood friends, recalled how Castillo was very vocal about his dream of becoming a lawyer back when they were just kids.
Ironically, it was in law school where he met his end.
While distraught and grieving, Castillo's family thanked the public for their continued support in seeking justice for the slain law student.
"Please continue praying for us. Thank you for the love and support. Maraming maraming salamat po!," Castillo's father said.

At a Senate hearing on Monday, John Paul Solano, the fratman who had tried to resuscitate "half-dead" Castillo inside the Aegis Jvris office in Manila and later rushed him to the hospital, tagged 6 other fraternity members in the hazing death.
The Senate has yet to call another hearing to probe Castillo's untimely demise.
Solano was released Wednesday afternoon, just as Castillo was being laid to rest.

abs-cbn.title: DOJ orders release of primary suspect in fatal hazing of UST student
content: MANILA- (UPDATE) The Department of Justice (DOJ) has ordered the release of John Paul Solano, one of the primary suspects in the fatal hazing of law freshman Horacio Castillo III.
In a 5-page resolution dated Sept. 26, DOJ prosecutors ordered a deeper probe into the case of Castillo and said Solano should be released since he surrendered.
The DOJ added that at the time police looked for respondents, Solano was not yet considered a suspect but only a person of interest.
The resolution explained that it was not right to subject Solano to inquest proceeding for perjury which only has a penalty of imprisonment of 6 months and 1 day to 2 years and 4 months.
Solano, a member of the Aegis Jvris fraternity which is tagged in the death of Castillo, surrendered last week and was placed under the temporary custody of the Manila Police District.
Solano, who is facing charges of murder, violation of Republic Act (RA) No. 8049 (Anti-Hazing Law), perjury, robbery, and obstruction of justice, was ordered released as Castillo is laid to rest.
He was earlier identified as the "good samaritan" who brought the bruised body of Castillo to the hospital but later on emerged as a primary suspect in the case.
Sen. Juan Miguel Zubiri on Tuesday said Solano had tagged at least 6 other members of the Aegis Jvris fraternity in Castillo's death.
Solano gave a tell-all account in an executive session following the Monday night Senate probe.
The DOJ is set to form a 3-man panel of prosecutors to be led by Asst. Acting Prosecutor Villanueva for the case of Castillo.
Preliminary investigation of the case has been scheduled on Oct. 4 and Oct. 9.
-with a report from Johnson Manabat, DZMM

abs-cbn.title: A mother's cry for justice
House panel endorses revisions to anti-hazing law to plenary
content: MANILA- The House Committee on Justice has endorsed to the plenary a substitute bill that seeks to fully outlaw hazing and regulate initiation rites in fraternities, sororities, and organizations.
The endorsement comes amid public outrage over the fatal hazing of University of Santo Tomas law freshman Horacio Castillo III.

The proposed measure expands the definition of hazing to cover psychological injuries to the victim and defines initiation and 
initiation rites which are not present in the current law.
Under the measure, perpetrators of hazing are not exempted from penalties even with the consent of the victim.

The bill also imposes certain requirements prior to any initiation rite such as the submission of a medical certificate by those subjected to initiation, monitoring of initiation rites, registration of fraternities and sororities with schools, and registration with the local government unit if the group is community-based.
A faculty adviser shall be assigned to fraternities and sororities to monitor their activities.
No one objected when a motion was made for the committee to adopt the bill.
Prosecution under this proposed law will not bar prosecution for other offenses.
The bill will also allow a judge to impose the penalty of life imprisonment on hazing cases.

abs-cbn.title: Bangkay ng babae natagpuan sa Cebu
content: Isang bangkay ng babae ang natagpuan ng mga residente sa loob ng kanilang subdivision sa Barangay Lawaan 3, Talisay City, Cebu Martes.
Kinilala ang biktima na si Mae Azalia Albasin.
Alas-10:30 ng umaga nang madiskubre ang bangkay na may tama ng bala sa tiyan, hita at braso.
Ayon sa kaniyang ina na si Remy Logan, nagpaalam ang biktima na may pupuntahan lamang.
Pero paniwala ng kaniyang ina, ang karelasyon nito ang pumatay sa anak. Sabi niya, lagi daw pinagbabantaang papatayin ng lalaki ang kaniyang anak.
Huling nag-away umano ang dalawa nitong Linggo kung saan muling pinagbantaang papatayin ang kaniyang anak.
Iniimbestigahan na din ng awtoridad ang ulat ng mga residente na nakita nilang itinapon mula sa isang puting van ang bangkay ng biktima.
Naghahanap na rin ang awtoridad ng CCTV video sa lugar upang makatulong sa imbestigasyon.

abs-cbn.title: 4 sugatan sa magkasunod na pagsabog sa Maguindanao
content: Apat na katao ang sugatan matapos sumabog ang isang improvised explosive device (IED) sa Barangay Semba, Datu Odin Sinsuat sa Maguindanao, Miyerkoles.
Alas-7:20 ng umaga nang sumabog ang IED sa gilid ng kalsada halos 700 metro ang layo mula sa training school ng Philippine Army 6th Infantry Division.
Walang nasugatan o namatay sa unang pagsabog.
Pero sa pag-responde ng mga pulis, sundalo at barangay officials upang i-kordon ang lugar at suriin ang pinangyarihan ng insidente, isa pang bomba ang sumabog.
Ito ay 10 metro lamang ang layo mula sa lugar kung saan sumabog ang unang bomba.
Dito na nagtamo ng mga sugat sina Staff Sergeant Eddie Cane, Barangay Sema Chairman Pendatu Sinsuat, Barangay Kagawad Sinarimbo Lalaog, at isang Police Officer 2 Pendililang.
Base sa salaysay ni Lalaog, hindi umano nila akalain na may pangalawang bomba pa pala na iniwan sa lugar.
Lumalabas sa imbestigasyon na Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) ang itinuturong suspek sa pambobomba.
Sa post blast investigation, lumabas na ang bomba ay gawa sa pulbura na ginamitan ng concrete nail at isinilid sa plastic container.

Ayon kay 6th ID Commander Major General Arnel dela Vega, ang pambobomba ay posibleng bahagi ng diversionary tactics ng BIFF upang ilihis ang atensyon ng militar sa patuloy na law enforcement operations laban sa kanila sa tinaguriang "SPMS box" o ang magkakaratig bayan ng Shariff Aguak, Pagatin, Mamasapano, at Shariff Saydona sa Maguindanao.
Nagdulot naman ng pangamba sa mga residente ang magkasunod na pagsabog.

Ayon sa military, mas palalakasin pa nila ang kanilang intelligence gathering upang mapigilan ang paghahasik ng karahasan. Naniniwala ang militar na ang suspek ay maaring naninirahan malapit sa pinangyarihan ng pagsabog.

Kasalukuyang nagpapagaling sa Camp Siongco Station Hospital ang sugatang sundalo at pulis. Si Sinsuat naman ay isinugod sa Cotabato Regional and Medical Center habang nakalabas naman agad ng ospital si Lalaog matapos magtamo ng shrapnel wound sa tuhod.

abs-cbn.title: 14 anyos na dawit sa riot, nabaril umano ng pulis
content: Sugatan ang isang 14 anyos na binatilyo matapos mabaril umano ng pulis sa Maynila.
Ayon sa ama ng biktima, pauwi ang binatilyo kasama ang mga kaibigan mula sa isang birthday party, bandang alas-3 ng madaling araw, nang mapaaway ang kanilang grupo sa bahagi ng Lawton sa Maynila.
Rumesponde ang dalawang pulis na nagpakawala umano ng warning shots.
Limang putok ng baril ang narinig sa lugar.
Tinamaan ng bala ang binatilyo sa kaniyang paa.
Batid naman daw ng ama ng binatilyo na maling nakipag-away ang anak.
Pero sana, hindi nabaril ang anak.
Kasalukuyang nasa ospital ang biktima at nsumailalim sa operasyon upang matanggal ang bala.
Nangako naman ang hepe ng Manila Police District Station 5, na may sakop sa lugar na pinangyarihan ng insidente, na aalamin kung pulis nga ba nila ang rumesponde sa riot.
Iimbestigahan din kung nanggaling sa baril ng pulis ang balang tumama sa binatilyo, dahil posible rin umanong galing iyon sa grupong nakaaway ng binatilyo.
-- Ulat nina Fred Cipres at Miguel Dumaual, ABS-CBN News

abs-cbn.title: Nanlaban? Most Pinoys doubt police account of drug killings, says SWS
content: MANILA- More than half of Filipinos have expressed doubt that many of those killed in anti-drug operations fought it out with cops, results of a Social Weather Survey (SWS) showed.

The survey results, released Wednesday, revealed that 54 percent of Filipinos agree with the test statement: “Marami sa mga pinatay ng mga pulis sa kampanya laban sa ilegal na droga ay hindi totoong nanlaban sa pulis.”
(Many of those killed by the police in the anti-drug campaign did not really fight police)
Of the 54 percent, 20 percent "strongly agree" to the statement; 25 percent were undecided while the remaining 20 percent disagreed.

Skepticism over the "nanlaban" reason was highest in Metro Manila, where 63 percent of the population think that many of those killed did not really fight police. Results were slightly lower in the rest of Luzon at 56 percent, and in the Visayas and Mindanao, both at 49 percent.
The "very poor" are also more likely to doubt the "nanlaban" reason for killings linked to police.

Fifty-eight percent of those in class E meanwhile disagree with the "nanlaban" reason, while 54 percent of those in class D or the masses disagree. Upper classes meanwhile (ABC) recorded a lower score of 40 percent.

Several rights groups have expressed concern over President Rodrigo Duterte’s bloody anti-narcotics campaign, which is legitimized by PNP's ‘Oplan Tokhang’ program, where policemen knock and plead at the doorsteps of suspected drug users and peddlers, and ask them to surrender.
The administration has several times defended the campaign, saying drug suspects killed in legitimate police operations had put up violent resistance.

Latest police estimates placed the number of drug suspects slain in legitimate police operations at 3,800. Human rights groups meanwhile placed the figure at 13,000, which the administration has described as overblown.
NOT REALLY DRUG PUSHERS?
Nearly half of Filipinos (49 percent) meanwhile think that many of those killed in police anti-drug operations are not really drug peddlers while 23 percent disagree and 27 percent are undecided.

Most Filipinos living in Metro Manila (58 percent) think that those killed are innocent of selling drugs followed by those in Visayas at 52 percent, the rest of Luzon at 48 percent, and Mindanao at 45 percent.
Among social classes, only few from the upper classes ABC believe that those killed are innocent at 38 percent, followed by class E at 45 percent, then class D at 51 percent.
Majority of Filipinos also think that many lie to police by accusing personal enemies of drug pushing so that the latter would be killed in police operations.

Half of Filipinos agree to the statement “Marami ang nagsisinungaling at itinuturo ang kanilang mga personal na kaaway bilang drug user/pusher para mabigyang dahilan na patayin ang mga taong ito ng mga pulis o vigilante."
(Many are lying and accusing their personal enemies as drug users or pushers in order to give an excuse for these people to be killed by police or vigilantes.)
Metro Manila recorded the highest degree to the statement at 63 percent, followed by Mindanao at 51 percent, the rest of Luzon at 50 percent, and Visayas at 42 percent.
The survey was conducted from June 23-26, 2017 using face-to-face interviews of 1,200 adults aged 18 years old and above nationwide, 300 each in Metro Manila, Balance of Luzon, Visayas, and Mindanao.
The survey has a sampling error margins of ±3 percent for national percentages, and ±6 percent each for Metro Manila, Balance of Luzon, Visayas, and Mindanao.

abs-cbn.title: Palace to state schools, offices: Take down gov't officials' photos, display images of heroes
content: Palace issues order for schools, govt offices to replace photos of elected officials with photos of Filipino heroes | via @dgplacido pic.twitter.com/lq8sitSNTA

MANILA – Malacañang wants public schools across all levels and government offices nationwide to remove all photos of elected and appointed officials and instead display images of Filipino heroes. 
 
Executive Secretary Salvador Medialdea signed on Sept. 15 Memorandum Circular No. 25 ordering the said institutions to “display or exhibit the photographs, paintings or other forms of visual representations of Philippine Heroes in lieu of the photographs, paintings or other forms of visual representations of elected or appointed government officials.”
In issuing the memorandum circular, Malacañang said the move was aimed at promoting patriotism.

“The State shall provide the means to strengthen the people’s nationalism, love of country, and respect for its heroes by emphasizing the importance of Philippine national and local history in the daily life of Filipinos, with the objective of raising social consciousness and patriotism,” the memorandum read.
The order enforces President Rodrigo Duterte's earlier instruction to have his photos and those of other elected and appointed officials removed from state offices and institutions.
The circular also listed recognized Filipino heroes, as identified by the National Historical Commission of the Philippines, which shall serve as reference and guidance for compliance.

The list includes Jose Rizal, Andres Bonifacio, Emilio Aguinaldo, Apolinario Mabini, Marcelo H. Del Pilar, Juan Luna, Melchora Aquino, Gabriela Silang, Lapu-Lapu, Father Jose Burgos, Father Mariano Gomes, Father Jacinto Zamora, Emilio Jacinto, and Jose Abad Santos.

abs-cbn.title: Mag-anak na nakituloy sa tirahan ng kapitbahay, inanod ng rumaragasang baha
content: Hindi inaasahan ng mga residente ng Brgy. Parian sa Calamba, Laguna ang dulot na pinsala ng bagyong 'Maring' at 'Lannie' nang pumasok ito sa bansa nitong buwan lang.
Kuwento ng isa sa mga nakatira sa lugar na si Jofran Monge, gabi noong Setyembre 11 nang biglang tumaas ang tubig sa kanilang komunidad.
“Malakas ang ulan. Maghapon kami sa bahay. Tapos no'ng mga alas-9 ng gabi, tumingin pa ako sa labas, wala pang tubig na [dumadating],” ani Jofran.
“Maya-maya, may kumakatok sa bahay ko. 'Yong asawa ng kapitbahay ko, sabi niya sa’kin may tubig na.”
Dahil sa banta ng baha, lumikas si Jofran kasama ang apat niyang anak sa kanilang kapitbahay.
Kahit nasa ikalawang palapag nanatili ang pamilya, inabot pa rin sila ng tubig.
“Siguro kalahating oras, aba’y tumataas nang tumataas ang tubig. Akala ko naman hindi aabutin 'yong pinakatuktok talaga ng bahay kasi mataas na bahay nga po.”
“Biglang inanod 'yong bahay.”
Sa bilis at lakas ng agos ng tubig, inanod ng rumaragasang baha ang pamilya ni Jofran.
Kinaumagahan na nang malaman ng asawa ni Jofran na si Jessamin Mina ang nangyari sa kaniyang pamilya.
Ayon kay Jessamin, ipagdidiwang sana nila ang ikatlong kaarawan ng kaniyang anak.
“Nando’n po ako sa Manila no’ng nasa trabaho ako. May usapan kami ng mga anak ko na uuwi talaga 'ko kasi birthday po niya,” kuwento ni Jessamin.
“Tiningnan ko talaga 'yong bahay namin. Wala, hindi talaga makita. Maya-maya, may tumawag na rescue team galing sa Aplaya, may nakita raw [na] apat na bata, dalawang matandang lalaki.”
“Nanalangin talaga ‘ko na sana mga anak ko na ‘yon, ang asawa ko sana sila na ‘yon,” dagdag niya.

Paano nga ba hinarap ng pamilya Monge ang trahedyang ito?
Panoorin sa 'Red Alert' kasama si Jeff Canoy ngayong Miyerkoles pagkatapos ng Bandila sa ABS-CBN.

abs-cbn.title: Palace: No violation in cabinet SALN redactions
content: MANILA – Malacañang on Wednesday insisted that it did not commit any violation of the law when its records office redacted certain details in the statements of assets, liabilities and net worth (SALNs) of cabinet members.

Presidential Spokesperson Ernesto Abella made this pronouncement in light of moves in the Senate to look into possible violations related to the release of redacted SALNs of President Rodrigo Duterte's appointees.

“Implementation of FOI (freedom of information) is a learning process, especially with the concurrent application of the Data Privacy Act. The Executive has raised the SALN issue with the National Privacy Commission (NPC) and we are waiting for their guidance,” Abella said in a statement.

“Meanwhile, we reiterate that there were no violations committed related to the release of SALNs of some Cabinet members. The Executive would cooperate and would attend the investigation on SALNs if and once called by the Senate.”
Sen. Antonio Trillanes IV, chair of the Senate committee on civil service, government reorganization, and professional regulation, recently filed a resolution calling for a probe into the matter.

Trillanes’ resolution was triggered by a Philippine Center for Investigative Journalism (PCIJ) in-depth report which noted that some details of Cabinet members' SALNs were heavily redacted. This while the Civil Service Commission’s guidelines only allow agencies to shade the declarant’s address “for purposes of security."

Freedom of information advocates slammed the executive branch’s move to redact certain information in the SALNs, such as the description, exact location and acquisition costs of real properties, as well as the acquisition costs or amounts of personal properties.
Also redacted were the addresses of business interests and financial connections of the cabinet members, and their outstanding debt.

The NPC, in a news conference on Tuesday, clarified that information on the assets and liabilities of cabinet members need not be redacted. This prompted a Palace official to declare that if requested, new SALNs with fewer redactions would be released.
Under criticism, the Palace previously said the Data Privacy Act allows for the redaction of certain information in SALNs of cabinet members.
But the PCIJ quoted in its report CSC Assistant Commissioner Ariel Ronquillo as saying that the SALN Law and CSC guidelines should prevail.

abs-cbn.title: 'Walang malisya': Pacquiao explains comments on woman's livestream
content: https://t.co/B4PIpcTKcS
MANILA - Senator Emmanuel Pacquiao on Wednesday defended his comments on a livestream of Arzaylea Rodriguez, a 22-year-old American social media sensation.
Pacquiao earned the ire of some social media users recently when his verified account was seen to have commented "Hello!" and "Where are you from?" on Rodriguez's Instagram livestream.
"Lahat naman pwedeng makipag-usap sa akin live. Wala namang malisya doon. In fact, iyun lang 'yun. Tingnan mo, pagkatapos nun, wala na," the boxing champion-turned-lawmaker told reporters.
Pacquiao explained that he only found the livestream by chance.
"Pag open ko ng Instagram ko, may nakita akong live. Pag panoorin mo iyung live niya, mag-appear ka, 'Manny Pacquiao has joined your live,'" he said.

"Sabi niya, 'Oh Manny Pacquiao, hello!' So nag-hello ako... Tinatanong niya ako nasa Pilipinas ka ba? Sabi ko andito ako, where are you from? Iyun lang." 
 
Rodriguez is friends with Kylie Jenner, the youngest member of the celebrity Kardashian family. She had dated 5 Seconds of Summer guitarist and lead vocalist Luke Hemmings.
-- With reports from Zandro Ochona and Sherrie Ann Torres, ABS-CBN News

abs-cbn.title: 15 pulis-Caloocan na sumalakay, nagnakaw sa bahay pormal nang inireklamo
content: MAYNILA - Pormal nang naghain ng reklamo sa Department of Justice (DOJ) ang may-ari ng bahay na sinalakay at ninakawan ng mga pulis-Caloocan.
Mga pulis-Caloocan na may kasamang PWD na nag-raid sa bahay ng isang Ginang sa Tala Caloocan na nakunan ng CCTV, Inireklamo na sa DOJ. pic.twitter.com/LRZgM0X1IG
Patong-patong na reklamong robbery, Anti-Child Abuse Law, at trespassing ang kakaharapin ngayon ng 15 pulis-Caloocan na inireklamo ng biktimang itinago sa alyas na "Lorena."
Kabilang sa mga nakasuhan sina Chief Insp. Timothy Aniway Jr, Sr. Insp. Warren Peralta at ang 13 iba pa na pawang mga P01. Kasama rin sa reklamo ang nagsilbing asset ng raiding-team.
Matatandaang noong Setyembre 7, pinasok ng mga pulis-Caloocan ang bahay ng 51-anyos na ginang sa Barrio Sta. Rita sa Tala, Caloocan.
Sa kuha ng CCTV, makikita ang mga pulis na pinangungunahan ng isang pilay na lalaki na armado pa ng baril at naka-suot ng bullet proof vest.
Kasama ng raiding team ang isang bata na nakasuot ng hoodie kung saan makikita na pinagkukuha nito ang ilang personal na gamit sa loob ng bahay, at di sinasaway ng mga pulis.
Sa halip, sinenyasan pa ng isang pulis ang bata na huwag mag-ingay habang isinasagawa ang paggalugad sa loob ng target nilang bahay.

abs-cbn.title: Mga dayo sa Legazpi City, obligadong magparehistro sa barangay
content: Ipatutupad sa Legazpi City, Albay ang isang kautusang mag-oobliga sa mga residenteng iparehistro sa barangay ang mga dayo o bisita nila sa siyudad.
Alinsunod ito sa Executive Order No. 36-2017 o ang inter-barangay travel registration mechanism na ipinalabas ni Mayor Noel Rosal.
Inihanda na ng ilang punong barangay ang mga logbook na magsisilbing talaan ng mga bisita.
Papatawan ang mga lalabag sa kautusan ng multang hanggang P1,000.
Hati ang opinyon ng mga residente ukol sa patakaran.
Paliwanag ni Rosal, magsisilbi ang kautusan bilang pangkontra sa masasamang loob at pagkalat ng droga.
Napirmahan na ni Rosal ang executive order. Hinihintay na lang ang pirma ng mga kasapi ng Sangguniang Panlungsod bago maipatupad ang patakaran.
-- Ulat ni Karren Canon, ABS-CBN News

abs-cbn.title: Chinese na konektado umano sa droga, niratrat sa Las Piñas
content: Patay ang isang Chinese national matapos pagbabarilin ng riding-in-tandem sa Las Piñas City.
Sinasabing kalalabas lang mula sa korte ni Lee Yu Shin nang pagbabarilin siya ng mga suspek matapos dumalo sa hearing kaugnay sa kasong pagtutulak ng droga.
Inaalam pa kung may koneksyon ang pagpatay sa kasong kinahaharap ng biktima.
-- Ulat ni Jekki Pascual, ABS-CBN News

abs-cbn.title: Panelo: 'Inday Sara' qualified to be president
content: MANILA - Like father like daughter, Davao City Mayor Sara Duterte is very much qualified to become president, a Malacañang official said Wednesday.

President Rodrigo Duterte's elder daughter is just as "incorruptible" but "grittier" than her old man, qualities that will someday make her a good president, said Chief Presidential Legal Counsel Salvador Panelo,
"Si Cory Aquino naging presidente, housewife lang. Bakit naman itong lawyer, abogado, mayor, hindi puwede? Matapang pa. Incorruptible din," Panelo told a media forum.
President Rodrigo Duterte earlier said he "couldn't find" a better candidate for the next president other than his daughter Sara, fueling speculations of an emerging political dynasty.

The Dutertes, though widely popular in Davao City, have also been criticized for controlling local politics there for more than two decades now. Duterte's eldest son Paolo is currently Davao City Vice Mayor.
Panelo cited accounts by city hall employees describing the daughter as "stricter" than the father when he was the city mayor.
In 2011, she made the news when she punched a court sheriff for enforcing a demolition order despite her instruction to put in on hold for a few hours for humanitarian reasons.
"Puwede siyang maging presidente kung ako tatanungin mo. Pareho ng ugali ng tatay nya. Mas matindi pa nga eh. Abogada pa," he said.
But does the fiesty Davao Mayor want to?
"Ako na magsasabi sa inyo. Ayaw na ayaw niya na maging pulitiko. Pinilit lang talaga sya," Panelo added.

abs-cbn.title: Curfew para sa mga menor de edad, lusot na sa komite ng kamara
content: Inaprubahan na ng House committee on welfare of children ang panukalang pagpapatupad ng curfew sa mga bata sa buong bansa.
Sa panukalang batas, hindi na pwedeng magpakalat-kalat simula alas-10 ng gabi hanggang alas-5 ng umaga ang mga menor de edad, at hindi na rin maaaring matulog ang mga ito sa mga pampublikong lugar.
May parusa at multa mula P500 hanggang P1,000 ang mga magulang ng madadakip na mga bata, o community service ng lima hanggang sampung araw depende sa dalas ng paglabag.
Layon umano ng panukala na matiyak ang kaligtasan ng mga bata at ma-protektahan sila mula sa pang-aabuso.
Gayunpaman, pinapayagan naman sa labas ang mga bata sa mga sumusunod na pagkakataon:
Dadalhin sa barangay ang mga batang mahuhuli para sa verification at counseling.
Pinagbabawalan din ng panukalang batas na gumamit ng dahas ang awtoridad na huhuli sa mga bata.

abs-cbn.title: Sandiganbayan sends ex-CIDG chief Matillano to jail for perjury
content: MANILA- The Sandiganbayan 2nd Division has sent former Philippine National Police (PNP) Criminal Investigation and Detection Group (CIDG) chief Eduardo Matillano to prison after pleading guilty to perjury and other charges over failed disclosures in his statements of assets, liabilities and net worth (SALN).
The anti-graft court reached the decision following a hearing on Sept. 5, 2017, when Matillano withdrew his not guilty plea and entered a guilty plea instead.

This prompted the court, in a ruling penned by 2nd Division Chairperson Oscar Herrera Jr. with the concurrence of Associate Justices Michael Frederick Musngi and Lorifel Pahimna, to order Matillano's imprisonment.

For each of the 3 cases of perjury, Matillano was sentenced to
“one month and one day and two months of arresto mayor, as minimum, to one year, one day and eight months of prision correcional, as maximum.”
Meanwhile, for each of the 8 cases involving his failure to file SALNs over several years, Matillano was ordered to pay a fine of P1,000.

The Office of the Ombudsman had accused Matillano of perjury for failing to include his assets such as real estate properties, vehicles, and investments in his SALN reports from 2001 to 2003. He was also charged for failing to file SALNs from 1994 to 2000, and in 2004.
 
In September last year, Matillano again made the news when he was mentioned by self-confessed hitman Edgar Matobato as the one who assigned bodyguards to former House Speaker Prospero Nograles who were later allegedly ordered kidnapped and killed by then Davao City Mayor Rodrigo Duterte.
The testimony was part of Matobato's narration of Duterte's alleged involvement in a hit squad, which the President has denied.
Both Matillano and Nograles also denied Matobato's claim.

abs-cbn.title: Mag-asawang ilegal na gumagawa ng pustiso, huli sa Davao City
content: Kalaboso ang mag-asawang Joelan at Rezil Estoy matapos maaktuhang ilegal na gumagawa ng pustiso sa kanilang bahay sa Isla Verde Boulevard sa Davao City.

Isinagawa ang operasyon ng Davao City Anti-Scam Unit at National Bureau of Investigation base na rin sa reklamo ng Davao City Dental Chapter. Ayon sa lokal na pamahalaaan, nagkalat na ang mga ilegal na nagpa-practice ng dentistry sa lungsod.
Ayon sa pulisya, dati na rin nilang nahuli sa isang operasyon ang mag-asawa sa parehong kaso, dalawang buwan na ang nakalipas.
Ang mga suspek, aminado naman sa kanilang ilegal na gawain.

Paliwanag ni Dr. Carlos Capitan II na chair ng nabanggit na chapter, bukod sa unsanitized ang mga pustisong ginagawa ng mag-asawa, wala rin silang sapat na training o kaalaman sa paggawa nito.
    
Desidido naman ang Task Force Illegal Practice of Dentistry na kasuhan ang mga pekeng dental technician.

abs-cbn.title: CCTV: 13-anyos na estudyante, na-budol-budol
content: Sapul sa CCTV ang modus ng isang babae sa Valenzuela City nang biktimahin nito ang 13-anyos na estudyante na kalaunan ay tinangayan nya ng ilang personal na gamit.
Sa loob ng pitong minuto, kinausap ng suspek ang dalagita at sinama sa isang sulok.
Doon na biglaang ibinigay ng estudyante ang kanyang bag.
Ayon sa ama ng biktima, kinuha ng babae ang wallet at cellphone ng kanyang anak na nagkakahalaga ng P12,000.
Ang babae, nagpanggap diumanong nanay ng isa sa mga kaklase ng estudyante.
Sinabi raw ng babaeng nawala ang cellphone ng kanyang anak kaya gusto niyang inspeksyunin ang bag ng dalagita.
Ayon sa barangay, pangatlong kaso na ito ng budol-budol na inilapit sa kanila.
Matagal na raw nilang hinahanap ang babae na madalas mambiktima ng mga estudyante sa barangay Karuhatan, Valenzuela City.
Nanawagan ang barangay sa sinumang mayroong impormasyon tungkol sa suspek.
Binalaan naman nila ang mga estudyante na huwag basta-bastang sumama at makikipag-usap sa mga taong hindi nila kilala.
--Ulat ni Kristine Sabillo, ABS-CBN News

abs-cbn.title: Loyal to the end: Dog guards last day of Atio's wake
content: LOOK: Lega wearing "#JusticeForHoracio" shirt. She's with Nicolle, younger sister of Atio | via @koriquintos pic.twitter.com/4QItdh8cGz
MANILA - On the last day of the wake for law freshman Horacio "Atio" Castillo III, his dog "Lega" refused to leave his side.
Senator Juan Miguel Zubiri shared on Instagram a photo of the Golden Retriever sitting under the coffin of the University of Santo Tomas student.
"This is heart breaking," wrote Zubiri, a friend of Castilllo's father.
This scene is heartbreaking. Atio Castillo's loyal dog Lega did not want to leave her best friend's side last night at the last day of Atio's wake. So sad 😢😢 #HustisyaParaKayHoracio
A post shared by Migz Zubiri (@migzzubiri) on Sep 26, 2017 at 5:35pm PDT
A separate video by ABS-CBN News also showed Lega wearing a "Justice for Horacio" shirt while looking at Castillo's casket before the interment Wednesday afternoon.
WATCH: Lega wearing "Justice for Horacio" shirt looked at Atio before the interment this afternoon |via @koriquintos pic.twitter.com/vwe2I4FemP
Lega has taken to visiting her master's bedroom and wonders why he has not come home yet, his uncle Gerardo Castillo earlier said.
"My dearest Atio, Lega misses you so bad that she wants to kiss you but she cannot comprehend why you are no longer with her," Gerardo said in a Facebook post.
"Do you know Atio she goes to your room and wonder why you have not come home yet but I know she knows something must have gone wrong."
Castillo, 22, died of massive injuries after an apparent Aegis Jvris fraternity hazing. He will be laid to rest Wednesday.

abs-cbn.title: 'Lake Patrol' inilunsad ng PNP kontra terorista sa Lanao
content: Inilunsad ng Philippine National Police (PNP) sa Lanao del Sur Miyerkoles ang Lake Patrol, isang unit na magpapatrolya sa mga bayan na malapit sa mga ilog sa probinsiya laban sa banta ng mga taga-suporta ng Maute Group.
Sa ilalim ng programa ng Lake Patrol, may mga grupo ng pulis na mag-iikot sa mga bayan araw-araw para rumesponde sa anumang banta.
Samantala, ininspeksyon din ng ilang opisyal ang mga istasyon ng pulis sa Lanao del Sur.
Plano din ng PNP na dagdagan ang tropa sa mga bayan na hinarass diumano ng mga taga-suporta ng Maute noong isang linggo.
Ang programa ay inilunsad habang patuloy pa rin ang bakbakan sa gitna ng tropa ng gobyerno at mga terorista mula sa Maute group sa Marawi City, ang sentro ng probinsiya.
Nasa ilalim pa rin ng batas militar ang Lanao del Sur, kasama ang buong Mindanao.

abs-cbn.title: Address lang ang puwedeng takpan: CSC nagsalita sa 'redactions' sa SALN
content: Maaaring humarap sa ilang kasong administratibo ang mga kawani ng pamahalaan na magtatakip ng ilang impormasyon sa kanilang mga Statement of Assets, Liabilities and Net Worth, saad ng isang opisyal ng Civil Service Commission Miyerkoles.

"Tanging ang address lamang ang maaaring takpan sa mga Statement of Assets, Liabilities and Net Worth upang protektahan ang privacy ng mga opisyal," ani Ariel Ronquillo, assistant commissioner ng Civil Service Commission.
"'Yung ibang information pertaining to the properties, dapat nakalabas po iyon... Dapat nakalagay yung acquisition cost at date of acquisition ng property na real and personal," dagdag ni Ronquillo.

Ayon kay Ronquillo, ang mga opisyal na hindi maglalahad ng kanilang buong SALN ay maaaring lumalabag sa Executive Order No.2 o ang "Freedom of Information EO" na pinirmahan ni Pangulong Rodrigo Duterte noong nakaraang taon.
Sa ilalim ng batas, maaaring humarap sa mga kasong administratibo o "disciplinary sanctions" ang mga opisyal na hindi magbibigay ng impormasyong hinihingi ng publiko.

"Obligasyon hindi lang nung filer pero pati nung review and compliance committee... (na) dapat lahat 'yan transparent, dapat nakikita yan ng kung sino man mag-iinspect sa mga SALN na 'yan," dagdag ni Ronquillo.
Naging issue ang pagtatakip ng ilang detalye sa SALN matapos itiman ang ilang mahahahalagang bagahi ng SALN ng ilang miyembro ng gabinete.

Sa kopya ng SALN na ibinigay ng Malacañang sa Philippine Center for Investigative Journalism (PCIJ), markado ng itim na tinta o "redacted" ang ilang detalye gaya ng pangalan ng mga anak, address at unang halaga ng pag-aari ng mga opisyal.
Depensa ng tagapagsalita ni Pangulong Rodrigo Duterte, kailangan daw protektahan ang mga "sensitibong impormasyon" na nakatala sa SALN para sa seguridad ng mga opisyal at pamilya nito.

Ngunit ayon kay Dr. Perlita Frago, assistant professor ng Department of Political Science ng University of the Philippines-Diliman, bagamat karapatan ng mga tao na ipaglaban ang kanilang “right to privacy” at “right to security”, hindi sakop ng Data Privacy Law ang mga naninilbihan sa gubyerno.

"Nakasaad din sa Data Privacy Act of 2012, nakalagay dito na ang mga nagta-trabaho sa gubyerno ay di covered. 'This act does not apply to the fact that the individual is or was an officer or employee of the government institution,'" paliwanag niya sa panayam sa DZMM Miyerkoles ng umaga.
Idiniin din ni Dr. Frago na nakasaad sa Konstitusyon na ang "public office is a public trust."

abs-cbn.title: Martin Diño exits SBMA, goes to DILG
content: Former SBMA chairman Martin Diño has confirmed that he has been offered the position of DILG Undersecretary and has accepted | @zenhernandez pic.twitter.com/DE7iapeLPH

(UPDATED) Fresh from his exit as chairman of the Subic Bay Metropolitan Authority, Martin Diño announced Wednesday that he has accepted an offer to stay in the administration of President Rodrigo Duterte as an official of the Department of the Interior and Local Government.
In a press conference, Diño confirmed that he has been tapped as DILG undersecretary.
Once appointed, Diño said he will give Barangay chairmen a week to report all drug suspects and activities in their area or else face probable suspension or removal from office.
Diño also promised that he will end alleged extra judicial killings by increasing the participation of village officials, who will be tasked to certify the legitimacy of police anti-drug operations.
NOW: @zenhernandez gives details on Martin Diño's acceptance of DILG Usec. post. pic.twitter.com/3pGiXDNcEI
BOOTED OUT?
President Rodrigo Duterte removed Diño from his previous post following complaints about "the way he was running the SBMA," said Salvador Panelo, the chief presidential legal counsel.
"Marami rin akong nakausap na investors dun. Ayaw nila si Diño," he said, adding he advised them to outline their concerns in a letter to the president.
Duterte had the matter investigated and decided "effectively" to sack Diño by assigning a concurrent SBMA chairman and administrator, Panelo said.
Wilma Eisma on Tuesday took oath as both SBMA chairman and administrator.

Eisma’s appointment ends the power struggle between her and Diño. They had been at odds over certain decisions in the agency, issuing contradicting orders that had affected SBMA operations.
 
It also comes in the wake of the President’s signing of Executive Order No. 42, which repeals EO 340 issued by former President and now Pampanga Rep. Gloria Macapagal Arroyo in 2004.
The old EO had separated the “powers, functions and duties of the Chairman of the SBMA Board and the Administrator as Chief Executive Officer of the SBMA.”

In repealing the Arroyo order, Duterte noted that it “created confusion with regard to the scope of authority, powers, functions and duties of the Chairman of the SBMA Board and the Administrator of the SBMA that has adversely affected the operations of the SBMA, as well as of the numerous investors and locators therein.”

Diño, a former chairperson of the Volunteers Against Crime and Corruption (VACC), served as the presidential candidate of Duterte's party, Partido Demokratiko Pilipino–Lakas ng Bayan, in the May 2016 elections until then Davao City Mayor Duterte decided to run for the position, replacing him at the last minute.

His daughter Liza Diño-Seguerra was appointed Film Development Council of the Philippines (FDCP) Chairperson in August while her spouse Aiza Seguerra was appointed Chairperson of the National Youth Commission.
With reports from Zen Hernandez and Christian Esguerra, ABS-CBN News

abs-cbn.title: Koko tells schools: Help stop frat violence
content: MANILA - Senate President Aquilino "Koko" Pimentel III warned Wednesday fraternity violence will persist if schools do not impose "vise-like" regulatory policies and stricter monitoring of fraternities and sororities.

The Anti-Hazing Law, enacted in 1995, has failed to deter fratmen from using physical violence against neophytes, as in the case of the fatal hazing of University of Santo Tomas law freshman Horacio Castillo III, Pimentel said.

A law graduate of the University of the Philippines where fraternities and sororities are officially recognized, Pimentel said school authorities should make compliance to the Anti-Hazing Law a prerequisite to the recognition of campus organizations.

"University and college officials should recognize fraternities and similar organizations so they can be subject to regulation. They should then be extremely strict about requiring fraternities to submit a list of their officers and members, as well as their activities for the semester or school year," he said.

Under the law, initiation rites are allowed if organizations have secured a written notice from school officials 7 days before their activity. At least 2 school representatives are required to attend the rites and ensure that no violence is used.
"If fraternities do not meet these requirements, then they should not be recognized and should have no business operating inside the campus," the Senate chief said.

"If school authorities receive information that these groups continue to defy their rules and regulations, then they should not hesitate to sanction erring students with suspension––or even heavier penalties." 
 
The 22-year-old Castillo was found dead after an apparent Aegis Jvris fraternity hazing. His death has spurned separate House and Senate inquiries seeking to overhaul the Anti-Hazing Law.

abs-cbn.title: Kontraktor itinangging nagpabaya sa mga basura sa Manila Bay
content: MANILA - Itinanggi ng isang waste management firm Miyerkoles na kagagawan nila ang mga nagkalat na basura sa Pier 18 sa Manila Bay.

Inanunsyo Martes ng Department of Environment and Natural Resources na nanganganib ipasara ang transfer station ng Philippine Ecological Systems Corp. (PhilEco) dahil sa mga pagkalat sa mismong pampang ng Manila Bay ng mga basurang hinakot nila.
Sakaling mapasara ang transfer station, posibleng hindi makolekta ang mga basura mula sa Maynila, Navotas, Malabon at Obando sa Bulacan.

Pinabulaanan ng R2 Builders Group, may subsidiary sa Phileco, na sa kapabayaan nito nag-ugat ang problema.
 
Ani R2 Builders consultant Jimmy Policarpio, inanod lamang ang karamihan ng mga basura mula sa Cavite dahil sa mga malalakas na ulan kamakailan.
Nahukay naman aniya ang iba pang basura nang gawin ang isang kalsada sa Pier 18.
"Gumagawa na po ng kalsada papunta doon sa barge. Para po magawa ang kalsada, you have to compact the road itself," ani Policarpio sa panayam ng DZMM.
"Lumalabas po na iyun palang dating kalsada, sa ilalim po pala noon ay puro basura kaya kulay brown."
Dagdag ni Policarpio, gagastos lamang ang kumpanya kung itatambak ang mga hinahakot na basura sa gilid ng daan, kaya idinidiretso nila ang mga ito sa barge.
"Kapag itinambak niyo po sa tabi iyun, kukuha na naman kayo ng payloader, dadalhin na naman ninyo sa mga barges. Napakagastos po noon," paliwanag niya.
May makina rin aniyang sumisipsip sa mga katas na basura para dumiretso ito sa barge at hindi ma-pollute ang tubig.
Ibinahagi rin ni Policarpio na wala pa silang natatanggap na memo mula sa DENR. Katunayan aniya, sa balita lamang nila nalaman ang mga alegasyon ng kapabayaan laban sa PhilEco.
Dadalo sa isang technical conference sa Oktubre 3 ang PhilEco, DENR, at mga opisyal ng mga apektadong munisipalidad at siyudad.

abs-cbn.title: REDACTED: Batas sa data privacy, di sakop taong-gobyerno: UP prof
content: Tama nga bang sumandal ang ilang miyembro ng gabinete sa batas hinggil sa Data Privacy para hindi isiwalat ang mahahalagang detalye sa kanilang statement of assets, liabilities and net worth (SALN)?

Ayon kay Dr. Perlita Frago, assistant professor ng Department of Political Science ng University of the Philippines-Diliman, bagamat karapatan ng mga tao na ipaglaban ang kanilang “right to privacy” at “right to security”, hindi sakop ng Data Privacy Law ang mga naninilbihan sa gobyerno.

"Nakasaad din sa Data Privacy Act of 2012, nakalagay dito na ang mga nagta-trabaho sa gobyerno ay di covered. 'This act does not apply to the fact that the individual is or was an officer or employee of the government institution,'" paliwanag niya sa panayam sa DZMM Miyerkoles ng umaga.
Ipinaliwanag ni Frago na sa dami ng batas--Republic Act 6713, Right to Privacy, at Executive Order No.2--nagkakasalungat na ang mga ito at lumalabas na tila lahat ay may punto.

"Ang kulturang ito ay pinangalanang bureaucratic ambiguity. Sa isang banda naniniwala tayong lahat na the law must apply to all. Kaya lang paano mo ia-apply kung sa reyalidad, ito ay mahirap i-apply dahil sila ay ambiguous at conflicting in reality," sabi niya.
Idiniin din ni Dr. Frago na nakasaad sa Konstitusyon na ang "public office is a public trust."
Dahil dito, dapat umanong handa ang sinuman na nasa gobyerno na mag lahad ng lahat ng kanyang ginagawa.
"Ang ating Constitution ay nagsasabi na kung ikaw ay nanunungkulan sa isang pampublikong opisina, ito ay opisinang naka-ugat din dito ang tinatawag na public trust," sabi ni Dr. Frago.

Sa in-depth report ng Philippine Center for Investigative Journalism (PCIJ), iniulat nitong may mga detalye sa SALN ng ilang gabinete ng pamahalaan ang burado sa kabila ng alituntunin ng Civil Service Commission na pwedeng ang tirahan lamang ang burahin para sa seguridad ng magde-deklara ng SALN.
Para kay Dr. Frago, ang Konstitusyon pa rin ang dapat na balik-balikan.

"Bagamat ang sinasabi ng lahat na ang Konstitusyon ay isang dokumento at hindi naman ito magsasalita on its own, so kailangan ng mas malinaw na batas, implementing rules and regulations upang maipatupad ang mga nilalaman nito," sabi niya.
Dagdag niya, "mga tao pa rin ang nagi-interpret ng batas na ito kayat nagkakaganito ang topic na ito at ang isyung ito ay nagiging usaping at nagkakaroon ng maraming debate dito."

abs-cbn.title: Hazing suspect sa pagkamatay ni Castillo: 'Masakit din sa akin'
content: MANILA - Ibinahagi ni John Paul Solano, pangunahing suspek sa fraternity hazing ni University of Santo Tomas student Horacio Castillo III, na dinaramdam n'ya ang pagkamatay nito lalo't sinubukan pa umano ni Solano na iligtas ang biktima.

Unang sinabi ni Solano na nahanap n'ya ang katawan ng 22-anyos na si Castillo sa Tondo, Maynila nitong Setyembre 17, ilang oras matapos itong magpaalam sa mga magulang na dadalo sa welcoming rites ng Aegis Jvris fraternity.

Kinalaunan, inamin din ni Solano na nagsinungaling siya sa unang statement ng pulisya. Aniya, nilapatan n'ya ng first aid si Castillo sa Aegis Jvris fraternity library matapos siyang papuntahin doon ng ilang kapwa fratmen.
Nagtatrabaho bilang medical technologist si Solano. Rescue volunteer din aniya siya ng Army Reserve Command at Metro Manila Development Authority (MMDA).
Kuwento ni Solano sa panayam ng DZMM, nasa 15 hanggang 20 minuto niyang binigyan ng cardiopulmonary resuscitation o CPR si Castillo, pero hindi na ito na-revive.
"Nalungkot ako, kasi iyun ang purpose ko kung bakit ako nagpunta ta's hindi rin na-save. So masakit din sa akin," sabi ni Solano, mula sa kanyang selda sa Manila Police District.
"Kahit sinong rescuer naman, ginawa iyung best nila, tapos parang walang nangyari, masakit iyun."
Nasampahan na si Solano ng patong-patong na kaso kaugnay ng insidente.
Sa hearing ng Senado Lunes, iginiit niya na hindi siya nakilahok sa hazing ni Castillo.
Pinangalanan din n'ya sa isang executive session ang 6 na fratmen at isang non-member na inabutan niya sa Aegis Jvris library nang bigyan ng first aid ang law freshman.
Hindi naman nangangamba si Solano na babalikan siya ng mga kasama sa fraternity sakaling kuhanin siya bilang state witness at mapalaya.
"Sa ngayon po, hindi na kasi nasabi ko na naman po doon kung sino iyung mga 'yun. If ever -- huwag naman sana -- na mawala ako, may nakakaalam na rin pong iba, more or less iyung senators po."
"That would be good pero para sa akin, hindi naman ganoon ka-savage or barbaric ang utak ng mga brods ko to kill me for that reason."
Nagpaabot din siya ng pakikiramay sa pamilya ni Castillo na ililibing ang nasawing law student ngayong Miyerkoles. Aniya, "Nasabi ko na rin po, pero my condolences na lang po sa family."
Ulat ni Lyza Aquino, ABS-CBN News

abs-cbn.title: M4.5 quake hits sea off Sarangani
content: MANILA - A magnitude 4.5 earthquake was recorded off the coast of Sarangani, Davao Occidental Wednesday, the Philippine Institute of Volcanology and Seismology (Phivolcs) said.
The earthquake's epicenter was located 174 kilometers southeast of Sarangani. It struck at 9:25 a.m.
The tremor was tectonic in origin and had a depth of 33 kilometers below the seabed.
Phivolcs said no major damage and aftershocks were expected from the earthquake.

abs-cbn.title: Taxi driver, lalaking nagbabakasyon arestado sa Davao buy-bust
content: DAVAO CITY – Dalawang lalaki ang naaresto sa isinagawang magkahiwalay na buy-bust operation ng awtoridad sa lungsod.
Nakilala ang mga nadakip na sina Alex Dimananal, 34-anyos, at taxi driver na si Eliseo Pelisco, 47.
Unang nahuli nitong Martes gabi si Dimananal sa Purok 4, Barangay Lizada sa Toril.
Sa report, nagpalipat-lipat umano si Dimananal ng lugar ng kanilang transaksiyon mula Sasa area hanggang sa umabot sa Toril.
Narekober sa kanya ang tatlong elongated sachet ng hinihinalang shabu na nagkakahalaga ng P5,000, cellphone, at P1,000 na marked money.
"Newly identified personality siya,” ayon kay Senior Inspector Noel Villahermosa.
Residente ng Talayan, Maguindanao si Dimananal at nagbabakasyon lamang umano sa Davao City.
Base sa intelligence report ng awtoridad, kumukuha ng supply si Dimananal sa Cotabato City at ibinebenta sa Davao City.
"Na-frame-up lang ako... matagal na ako huminto nung nag-asawa na ako, baka wala na sila ibang mahuli," depensa nito.
Samantala, alas-2 Miyerkules ng madaling araw nang mahuli rin ng San Pedro Police si Pelisco sa buy-bust operation sa Lanang, Davao City.
